page.title: 02Waverley Farm
page.content: Waverley farm is situated 1km. S.W. of Lyndhurst. It covers 162.8 hectares. The farm is managed by Mr.Smith, but owned by a London - based company. Mr.Smith concentrates on dairy farming, owning 155 Friesians. His land is used mainly for intensive grazing, but there is 1 field of maize which provides fodder for cattle. The soils range from heavy clay to gravel, sand & peat. Drainage proves to be an expensive problem, because where 2 different soils meet, water has collected to form springs. The relief is undulating and the land cover consists of wide open fields surrounded by many deciduous trees. There are 5 tractors on the farm, ranging from 30h.p. to 100h.p. Mr.Smith has two labourers to help him run the farm.
